title: How to Make a Birthday Cake Mix Martini

steps.headline: Take one of the plates and pour a generous amount of rainbow sprinkles on it (about a palm full).
Use can of whipped cream to rim the martini glass.
steps.description:
If rimming the glass is difficult, take the spare plate and make a circle of whipped cream about the size of the martini glass and dip the rim of the glass in it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/63\/Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/63\/Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid2363745-v4-728px-Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

steps.headline: Flip whipped cream rimmed glass over and gently press in the rainbow sprinkles on the plate.
steps.description: If desired, put about a palm full of the dry white cake mix onto a separate small plate to use as a garnish as well.

steps.headline: Add the four ice cubes to martini shaker.
Use the double sided jigger to measure and pour the liquid ingredients into the shaker.
Add the dry white cake mix to the martini shaker
Use the four prong stainless steel strainer to strain contents of shaker into the prepared martin glass.
steps.description: For a better consistency, strain twice. If straining twice, strain into a separate glass first then strain the second time into the martini glass.

text:
Garnishing the Martini Glass Take one of the plates and pour a generous amount of rainbow sprinkles on it (about a palm full). Use can of whipped cream to rim the martini glass. If rimming the glass is difficult, take the spare plate and make a circle of whipped cream about the size of the martini glass and dip the rim of the glass in it. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/63\/Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/63\/Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/aid2363745-v4-728px-Make-a-Birthday-Cake-Mix-Martini-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"} Flip whipped cream rimmed glass over and gently press in the rainbow sprinkles on the plate. If desired, put about a palm full of the dry white cake mix onto a separate small plate to use as a garnish as well. Making the Martini Add the four ice cubes to martini shaker. Use the double sided jigger to measure and pour the liquid ingredients into the shaker. Add the dry white cake mix to the martini shaker Shake Well. Use the four prong stainless steel strainer to strain contents of shaker into the prepared martin glass. For a better consistency, strain twice. If straining twice, strain into a separate glass first then strain the second time into the martini glass. Enjoy!
